b'Tatas buy Air India. 
AI had 65k cr debt, but Tatas will pay only 18k cr. (the remaining debt essentially absorbed by govt). 
Essentially Tatas paid 30cents on the dollar for debt. 

Fair price. Only way to do deal. Excellent job by GOI to let go of cash flow negative airline.'

b"There's no XYZ lobby. There's science and the lack of it. That's all. \nStop trying to rally support by hiding behind some ancient culture and imagining lobbies. Stop trying a non-stop us vs them. Stop trying eternal victimhood.\nPlease. lives are at stake. https://t.co/J9BmpgAgsK"

b"It's not a Bollywood movie. A plane load, truck load, train load doesn't mean much, even if it makes for good visuals.\nUltimately, numbers matter. 200 crore vaccine doses. Within the next few months. I'd rather see a boring piece of paper with a real plan than a dramatic picture."

b"btw, for those hurt pride/ego types justifying why pfizer was not approved in feb (coz we were right blah blah) - do note that a blanket approval has been given now to all major intl approved vaccines. so, please. swallow the damn pride, and save lives. and don't bore."

b"Oh but why couldn't Pfizer agree to our terms, some say.\nWell, we needed Pfizer's vaccine more than they needed us. We could have saved lives if we kept our ego down and said 'how can we make it work Pfizer' rather than 'why can't you listen to us.'\nLives could have been saved."

b"The point is not Indian vs foreign vaccines. The point is enough vaccines and enough supply. And for that we need them from all over right now. Save the nationalism for Independence Day. Right now let's save lives at any cost. Please."

b"The airplanes we fly in, mobile phones we type tweets on, the medical equipment we use, the weapons that protect us at the border - are made abroad. Vaccines can also be made abroad. Indian vaccines may be good, but if we don't have enough supply. We have to get from abroad too."

b"Pfizer and Moderna are the best vaccines. They have been out since Dec-2020. Why don't we have them in India yet? Do we not deserve the best? Don't we buy defense equipment from abroad? Is this not a war like situation? Why does the vaccine have to be made here and only here?"

b"Remember, we need global help right now to get the vaccines. The person who needs the help cannot have ego. \nEgo never served anyone anyway, but if we keep ego or fake pride now, when we need help, we won't succeed. \nHeads down, get to work, source and administer the vaccines."

b'Solution is in sourcing and administering billions of doses of the vaccine. \nWe should have a clear idea and targets on how many people will be vaccinated and by when. \nJust anecdotal stories of efforts being done, while commendable, is not enough.'

b'The Pfizer vaccine, one of the best ones, used in most developed countries, applied for permission in India in Dec-2020. India instead asked them to do more studies here. Pfizer withdrew its application in Feb-21. Imagine lives saved if we allowed the vaccine from December itself'

b"The world today is inter-linked. Raw materials and key technologies are all coming from different places. To do well, a nation has to get along and work with everyone else, not hate on other nations or bring ego. Let's learn this lesson now as we take help from various nations."

b"Considering India is 1/6th of humanity, we should have tried to take early equity stakes in all major vaccines being developed. We didn't, so now we will need to work harder and maybe overpay to source them. Also need to keep our ego down and take all the help we we can."

b'We need to pay whatever it takes for enough vaccines, whether manufacturing them here or importing them. We then need to administer the vaccines literally at every other street corner. Only then we will get out of this mess.'

b'My stance on farm bills remains same, they give the farmer more choice. My col from Sep, well before the current situation started. \n\nhttps://t.co/QW5EvuVJoP'

b"Of course govt will be concerned if influencers with global reach comment against farm bills.

This doesn't mean the bills are wrong,or the govt is defeated. 

And it definitely doesn't mean you should enjoy our country being shamed by people who don't know the full picture."

b"Indian farmer incomes are too low, less than half the average per capita GDP of India. The new laws liberalize agriculture and attempt to increase incomes.\n\nThis isn't about a twitter battle or which pop star said what. This is about true change in our country. Take it seriously."

b"Most developed countries have very high private sector participation in agriculture. That's how farmer incomes rise. The fear of change will never let you change, even for the better.

My column on farmer bills, and the status quo- change paradox:

https://t.co/4LADYCDD01"

b"Read before you outrage. Without the private sector, without the farmer's having more choice, India's agriculture sector will never improve. All sympathetic int'l pop icons should note this before reacting.

My col on Farmer Bills. Do read, then comment:
https://t.co/QW5EvuVJoP"

If yes, great work, share it everywhere. 

If no, make (new evidence) also part of the conspiracy. 

Repeat until everyone else not agreeing with you  is part of the conspiracy.'

b'Conspiracies require tremendous co-ordination and intelligence. In a country as chaotic as India.\nTo say -  6-7 major national agencies, are all part of some seamless conspiracy -  is virtually impossible. Don\xe2\x80\x99t get fooled by people incentivised to get your attention at any cost.'

b'This tweet is from over a month ago. As facts are coming out, it\xe2\x80\x99s proving more true. \n\nPlease don\xe2\x80\x99t get fooled or taken advantage of. If you want to contribute to a cause, there are plenty of a real ones in the country. Focus your passion there. https://t.co/jVNHDkYQYH'

b"It's v hard to make something.\n\nIt's v easy to destroy it."

b'The stories human beings love and understand the most are those with good people and bad people, all separate (Star Wars, Avengers.) We love to think we are good, someone else is bad.\n\nTruth is good and bad exists at the same time, within us, within society.'

b"When emotions decide a person's decisions - it leads to doom.

When emotions decide a nation's decisions - it leads to doom.

Always."

b"Freedom. Liberty. Equality. These are things our forefathers fought for. If in the name of 'cleanup' and being 'moral' and 'good' we give these values up, we would destroy something fundamental about being Indian, something our forefathers literally gave their lives for."

b"Bollywood is one of the few Indian things that works well. It creates revenue, taxes, jobs and a lot of happiness. Drugs cleanup is great, but if in the process we destroy Bollywood, we'd have destroyed one of the few Indian things that worked well."
b'A society that lets its artists get destroyed ultimately lets its soul get destroyed.'

b'"If we really cared about our farmers, we would give them access to the world and allow them to benefit from globalisation." 

From my earlier 2015 column, do read:
https://t.co/8OnKRlPZRc'

b"The only issue in privatization of agriculture, is that the private buyer is (potentially) far more powerful than the selling farmer. \nThe only solution to this is farmer's collectives, and negotiating teams who can deal with the private players. That will be needed, for sure."

b'Instead of spreading fear and conspiracies, those who claim to care for farmers should inform them on how to benefit from farmers bills. Maybe make small collectives, or  apps to show prices, demand and supply across regions, or  buyer-seller meets, export opportunities etc.'

b'My column from 2015, arguing for similar reforms that have come through now. Took 5 years, but good to see change.\n\n"Let\xe2\x80\x99s bake in India first: Open up the agriculture sector to help our farmers and our economy" https://t.co/8OnKRlPZRc'

b"Have done countless columns urging govt to open up the economy more. To not acknowledge when they do that is hypocritical. \nThe Farmer Bills are a major reform, and frankly needed to tap India's potential as a major agricultural powerhouse in the world."

b'We had LIC as the only insurance company. Other private players were allowed insurance which benefited the consumer. LIC is still around too.\n\nSame with the farmer bills. Private players will come. Improve choices for farmers. Govt will still be around.'

b"Learning more about the farmer's bills. However, whatever I researched so far, they seem to be well intentioned and will be good for farmers. \nFrom being forced to sell to a monopoly, to anywhere who offers them a better deal - it will improve farmer returns long term."

b"Horrible, horrible reasons people have drugs:
1. To recreate a past high (say, of fame) 
2. They don't have calories (WTF)
3. They are feeling low (seriously?)
4. To socialize with friends (stupid)
5. Boredom (really?)

Finally, only leads to:
1. Addiction
2. Destruction"

b"Natural highs come from achieving success, fitness, relationships. These require effort. It's the brain's reward system. These efforts make for a productive life.\n\nDrugs short-circuit. They give instant highs, and destroy the natural reward system.  Render you useless. Stay away!"

b"Don't do drugs.
They mess up your brain chemistry, changing your reward-motivation balance, making it difficult to work hard.
They are addictive.
They can kill you.
They are illegal.
The answer to life's problems can't be in a chemical. 
Drugs are not cool. Stay away from them."

b"A large part of Indian middle class, the one that consumes news media, the one that's loud on social media, get riled up about random issues in the news - is public sector employed.\n\nYou want Indians to care about economy? Cut public sector salaries and watch the fun."

b"Sections who definitely don't care about the economy:
1. Public sector employed/ their kids - salary fixed. Who cares GDP down 24% or 48%. .
2. Those who have no hope - even in the best of economy, nothing great will happen to them.

They want entertainment from news, not issues."

b"Why Indians don't care about the economy (apart from 5%):

1. They feel it makes no difference to them directly (bizarre).
2. Cheap 4G data means brain is distracted on the phone to focus on real issues.
3. They only want news with emotions and entertainment - economy has neither"

b"Some saying my today's tweet about developing countries cannot have same lockdown strategy as developed countries is with benefit of hindsight. Well this was my tweet on May 16. https://t.co/56S1WWG94w"
b"Celebrate the successful. Don't find reasons to hate on them. That's how successful nations are built."

b"A rich person can take one year off for health reasons.

A poor person can't. The poor person will somehow balance health and work.

That's  difference between developed and developing countries. Developing countries can't and shouldn't copy lockdown models of affluent countries."

b"The more labor intensive a country, the bigger it gets hit by a lockdown, which is about movement of people.

Rich countries have a higher portion of their economic activity automated and computerized. 

That's why India's GDP contraction is worse than many other nations."

b"Don't spread baseless rumors on a successful industry that contributes to GDP and creates lots of direct and indirect employment, especially in these difficult times. 

We are dealing with a -24% GDP contraction, it is no joke.

Don't be anti-success."

b'Lockdown affected all economies worldwide. But rich countries have the resources to withstand a contraction better than poor countries. They also already have good infra so that remains. In the end, poor countries will have to fight harder to come back and build themselves again.'

b'Focus on RHEA.

But the right RHEA.

Re Habilitating Economic Activity.'

b'A -24% GDP growth means:

- Govt revenues fall even more, as some taxes are on revenues, but many on profits,which have fallen more.
- Job growth v low,layoffs and pay cuts
- Crucial infra projects stuck
- Less capital to invest for growth

Fix: Relentless focus on economy alone.'
b'GDP growth: -24% for last quarter. \n\nRequires immediate attention to bring this back to normal. Will affect everyone, eventually.'

b'Not one interview, not one line where that boy spoke rudely to media or complained he was being unfairly targeted. They tell you to smile and stay quiet.But it eats you up inside.\n\nBetter to vent it out. I am glad I did, calling out fakes, bullies and getting it out of my system.'

b"You know what his loss tells me, don't always be humble and nice.

When a snake is trying to bite you, don't be humble and nice. Bite his head off, hard. Else the snake will kill you.

In life, be nice but don't let people walk over you or break you. Fight back and break them."
b"They tried to break him. They broke him.\n\nThey tried to break me too. They couldn't. Before they break me, I will break a hundred of them myself."

b"You went to an English medium school, your parents spoke English at home, you read English books and watched English shows growing up, great. 

But it doesn't give you the birthright to insult regular Indians who didn't have that. 

Power has shifted. Wake up to the new reality."

b"There's an enormous, unimaginable amount of hard work and anxiety behind any self-made Indian rising to the top. A certain section of brown outside-white inside elitists found it fun to insult such Indians.Not cool anymore. \n\nIt's because of that talented boy. God bless his soul."

b"It's no longer cool to piss on the work of self-made Indians. That obnoxious set of elitists has become quiet. First time I am seeing that. \n\nThat talented boy's loss has created this change. God bless his soul."

b'There\xe2\x80\x99s the loony right wing and the sensible right wing. 

There\xe2\x80\x99s the loony left wing and the sensible left wing. 

I like the sensible wing of both sides. 

I find the loony, inflexible wing of either stupid. 

What does that make me? Confused? Stupid? 

Or. Just sensible.'

b'We are good. They are bad. 

No you fool. We are all good and bad at the same time. If you haven\xe2\x80\x99t understood this about human nature, you haven\xe2\x80\x99t lived.

b"Lockdown creates a v strange political incentive structure:

Remove:
Cases go up: Why did u remove it? 

Don't remove it. 
If  cases down: see, it worked.
If cases up: see, cases would be even more if u didn't remove.

Hence, bias towards not removing it, despite massive cost."

b'To fund the massive fiscal costs of a rescue plan, the government could issue special crisis bonds, with a 10, 20, 30 year duration. Many people are likely to invest in them.'

b'Relying on charity and benevolence is not the way to handle a crisis like this. All that looks good on social media, but this needs a massive fiscal plan, far and beyond what charity, NGOs and requests can achieve. \n\nThe poor need help. In massive doses.'

b"The upper middle class and above:
There's nothing left to watch on Netflix.

The poor:
There's nothing left to eat.

#LockdownEffect"

b'Hi all,

b"If we can just brush the Hindu-Muslim issues aside for  next 20 years, and focus on growing the economy, we can easily reach $10,000 per capita GDP by 2040.
 
Then we can fight all we want.

But my guess is, when incomes reach that level, we won't fight like this."

b'Inflation: 6-year high

GDP growth: 6-year low

This needs to be our number one priority. The rest of the never ending and somewhat pointless identity politics stuff can wait.'

b'AAP changed its way of working dramatically last 2 years.

They listened to the criticism and acted on it. 

They are now leading in opinion polls in Delhi.

If they win, scaling up outside Delhi will become a possibility again.'
b'Ultimately no matter what posturing people do, every issue on Twitter boils down to do you like Modi or not.'

b'Effect of 99% cutoffs? A bunch of \xe2\x80\x9csmart\xe2\x80\x9d kids who are very good at pointing errors but miss the overall point. Ma\xe2\x80\x99am ma\xe2\x80\x99am college nahi university hai. Oh so bright u are. The essence of the statement doesn\xe2\x80\x99t change and you didn\xe2\x80\x99t get it but here, take ur \xe2\x80\x9cI am right badge\xe2\x80\x9d.'

b'Two big dates coming up

Feb 1: Budget. Will show how serious we are about the economy. 

Feb 11: Delhi election results. Some indication of the political impact of recent events. 

India may be whatever, but it is never boring.'

b'JNU is just one college.

There are nearly 40,000 colleges in India.

I understand it is important. But there is a limit to how much importance and attention one college gets.

There are more important issues in a country of 1.2bn people I am sure.'
b'I am going to disappoint everyone who thinks I am in a camp.'

b'People in India understand serving someone. Our faulty education makes people incapable of thinking for themselves. They find it hard to deal with independent minds with different opinions in different situations. But you were that side na? No, your brain was limited. Still is.'
b'@seemay \xf0\x9f\x98\x81\xf0\x9f\x98\x81'

b'I wish GDP had a religion so more people would care for it.
I wish healthcare was fought for like we fight for our traditions.
I wish scientific education was valued like our scriptures.
I wish the country\xe2\x80\x99s infrastructure was built like places of worship, with as much pride.'
b'I wish GDP had a religion so a lot more people would care for it.'
b'There\xe2\x80\x99s a lot of value in simplifying things. \n\nIt is not that simple to be simple.'

b'Saying \xe2\x80\x9cNRC will definitely come\xe2\x80\x9d and then saying \xe2\x80\x9cbut did I show u details yet?\xe2\x80\x9d

 is like saying

\xe2\x80\x9cyou will have to marry where I ask you to\xe2\x80\x9d  and then saying \xe2\x80\x9cbut did I show you any boys yet?\xe2\x80\x9d

Be clear. If it is not coming, shelve it. Restore peace and order.'

b'The NRC is unimplementable due to massive execution issues. 

Time to put it to rest. Not the right time at all. 

With growing US-Iran tensions, higher oil prices and our already weak economy, we need to do everything we can to restore stability.'

b'Many people have invited or welcomed me to their club given my recent specific views on a specific issue. 

Neither was I a member of the other club. Nor would I like to be of yours. 

Sure, happy to have a cup of tea now and then in either club. 

But Life membership? No thanks.'

b'Stand up for what you feel is right, that\xe2\x80\x99s all. 

Whatever you think is the right thing for your country. 

It doesn\xe2\x80\x99t have to agree with my view or anyone else\xe2\x80\x99s. 

But just make sure it is your view. You have thought through it and is not coming out of blind fandom or hate.'

b'Whatever their historical names, there are no Hindu or Muslim universities in India. They are all Indian universities. And they all must be protected.'

b'Many get confused about my politics here.  To be clear am only interested in an India where everybody lives in harmony and we have stellar economic growth. That is my dream. One-sided groupings bore me. I am not on your fixed side. I am on India\xe2\x80\x99s side. And am proud of that.'
b'Crashing the economy. Making jobs vanish. Shutting down Internet. Sending police in libraries. The youth may have patience, but don\xe2\x80\x99t test the limits of it.'
b'The youth is angry. There are not enough jobs. Salaries are low. Don\xe2\x80\x99t mess with them. The first priority should be to lift the economy back again.'
b'The CAB required more education, more consensus building, a lot better wording and frankly better intentions. Stirring the social pot constantly is going to hurt us and the already weak economy.'

b'Repeated and prolonged Internet shutdowns hurt business and the economy. Sends a message that we are an unpredictable, third-world country where things are not under control. Even non-democratic China never did it during Hong Kong protests.'
b'Lagta hai Delhi mein elections aane wale hain.'
b'People opposing CAB are those who want to include nobody and those who want to include everybody.'
b'Pollution or protest, it has to reach Delhi, else it doesn\xe2\x80\x99t seem to matter.'
b'Kashmir matters. Assam matters. Tripura matters.'

b'Internet shutdowns, in this era of online dependence for everyday life, should be avoided. If at all, they can be done on an exceptional basis for a very short time duration to diffuse a situation. To make it a way of life is draconian.'
b'Kashmir matters.'
b'Tripura matters.'
b'Assam matters.'
b'Shutting down Internet doesn\xe2\x80\x99t shut down the resentment.'

b"Money:
1. Is important. Anybody saying it isn't usually doesn't have much.
2. Gives you flexibility, options and the power to stand up for yourself.
3. Is a measure of value you provide, though not the only one
4. Is hard to earn, harder to keep and grow
5. Is not everything."

b'Happiness comes from:
1. Doing work you love
2. Having 3-4 people in life who really care
3. A healthy body, a decent diet
4. Enough sleep
5. Avoiding negativity at all costs.'

b"Time management (practically doing it):
1. Cut your phone screen time (most people are 5hrs+, get to 2)
2. Make to-do lists for next day the night before
3. Don't waste time on bad relationships and useless work
4. End of day, ask, how did I get closer to my goal today?"

b'3 things that make a big difference to your success (not dependent on talent)
1. Having clear goals- where you want to be by when
2. Being Positive- not wishing badly for others,taking positive steps when faced with difficulty
3. Working hard consistently for long period of time'

b'RT @chetan_bhagat: So who wanted to kiss whom? @iratrivedi\xe2\x80\x99s self-explanatory email from 2013 to me, esp last line, easily shows her claims\xe2\x80\xa6'

b'I am not a vindictive person. More than anything I just want me and my family to be left alone and people to ignore fake charges.  Love to all who supported me. I won\xe2\x80\x99t let you down. This was my #MeToo story. Peace out.'

b'Annoyed by my revelations, more baseless, twisted attacks may come on me, through her friends, wellwishers &/or others. Neither obligated nor inclined to respond. Please don\xe2\x80\x99t believe such nonsense. I may go silent on twitter to heal my family but I won\xe2\x80\x99t be shamed or silenced.'

b'To those who abused me last few days, hope you will do right by me now. Ultimately, is this movement about the truth or blindly supporting a particular gender? Please don\xe2\x80\x99t let your biases make you believe things that are not true.'

b'A person\xe2\x80\x99s reputation is their most prized asset and takes a lifetime of work to earn. To have these motivated, fake attacks on me is abhorrent and the sickest thing a person can do. Please don\xe2\x80\x99t support this kind of smear campaign.'

b'Shame on media like @outlookindia who carried a fake charges story without even checking with me. They could have easily checked on YouTube that I launched her book in 2015/16. Who calls their harasser as chief guest for their book launch? Video here: https://t.co/g6uIOVLjeS'

b"Also, it is she who comes from very powerful family connected to pol party (regularly dropped top names of people in power then ). i was less known in 2010. was intimidated by her. My old col on Air India talks of entitled IAS kid demanding upgrades at Air India counter. It's her https://t.co/GGNGjZgbz9"

b'So who wanted to kiss whom? @iratrivedi\xe2\x80\x99s self-explanatory email from 2013 to me, esp last line, easily shows her claims from 2010 are false, and she knows this too. This mental harassment of me and my family has to stop. Please don\xe2\x80\x99t harm a movement with #fakecharges #harassed https://t.co/SWeaSCfHLd'

b'Thank you - for spending your pocket money on my books at age 12, for staying with me in this journey so long, for still being so generous in your praise and for making my day by saying #TheGirlInRoom105 is my best so far. May god bless you. Keep reading! https://t.co/2BhewmSagj'
